metadata.title: National Oceanographic Data Centers of Japan, Canada, Russia, and USA
metadata.description: The data base in the Bering Sea includes serial oceanographic stations with observations of parameters such as temperature, salinity, oxygen, pH, alkalinity, phosphates, silicates and nitrates.  The total number of stations is about 45,000 from 1932 to 1996.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: The data base was created to carry out the national project "Russian Seas".

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: As Needed

Access constraints: Limitation access for Russian observation as the State property

Use constraints: Limitation use for Russian observations as the State property

Distribution liability: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
